revised_title: Meteorological Observations and Wind Patterns in London, 1774
tldr: This article presents an abridged view of the weather at London in 1774, focusing on wind patterns and rainfall. The author collects data from the Meteorological Journal of the Royal Society and provides a detailed analysis of the wind directions and the amount of rain in each month. The study reveals that the southwest wind prevailed more than any other, while the northeast wind was the second most frequent. The article also includes a breakdown of the sub-divisions of the southwest and northeast winds, as well as a table showing the number of fair and frosty days throughout the year.
